title: Calories in Sesame Seeds
meta_description: Discover calories in sesame seeds per tablespoon, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Whole, unsalted sesame seeds, raw or lightly toasted; 1 tbsp â‰ˆ9g; no added oils or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (white/black/hulled), processing, brand, and storage; values are averages. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One tablespoon of sesame seeds contains about 52 calories and 1.6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

tweaks.label: Toasted with 1 tsp oil per tbsp
Black sesame seeds (similar but slightly nuttier)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tbsp of sesame seeds?
What is the protein content in sesame seeds?
faqs.a: About 1.6 g protein per tablespoon, or 18 g per 100 g.

faqs.q: Are sesame seeds high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 4.5 g total fat per tbsp, mostly healthy unsaturated fats.
Yes, around 1.1 g dietary fiber per tablespoon.

faqs.q: How do calories in sesame change with preparation?
faqs.a: Toasting adds minimal calories; adding oil or using in pastes like tahini increases them significantly.
